results.title: Little Burgundy = La P'tite Bourgogne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget, George C. Stoney, Bonnie Sherr Klein and Maurice Bulbulian
results.brief_description: When an old area of a city is to be demolished to make way for a new low-rental housing development, is there anything that the residents can do to protect their own interests? This film, produced in 1968, airs such a situation in the Little Burgundy district of Montreal. It shows how citizens organized themselves into a committee that made effective representations to City Hall and influenced the housing policy.

results.title: Little Britain. The Complete first series
results.creator_credit: Myfanwy Moore, BBC and Steve Bendelack
results.brief_description: Little Britain as seen on ABC television is a surreal comedy featuring lunatics, misfits, teenage delinquents and bad transvestites. The BAFTA award winning series was written and performed by Matt Lucas and David Williams who’s range of the grotesque and, at the same time, everyday characters are set to surprise. Funny and perverse. Narrated by Tom Baker.

results.title: Little boy lost
results.creator_credit: Alan Spires, Summit International and Terry Bourke
results.brief_description: Based on an event that occurred in the township of Guyra, NSW, in 1960, this video is dedicated to the volunteers involved in the search for four year old Stephen Walls. Stephen disappeared whilst watching his father sheep herding. Initially it’s the police and local farmers who begin the search, but as night falls and it becomes evident Stephen may not be found, hundreds of locals join in. By the third day volunteers have spilled beyond the confines of the local community as interstate army brigades and other services are supplied. Stephen is eventually found after four days and three nights, in good health. This film highlight the dedication of the volunteers and the faith of Jacko and Dorrie Walls that their son would return to them safely. Starring John Hargreaves, Lorna Lesley, Tony Elliot and Nathan Dawes as Stephen Walls. Adapted from a storyline by John Powell and Suzanne Turner.

results.title: Little blue planet
results.brief_description: A contemplative piece about the little blue planet we call earth. Portrays the chaotic pace of modern city life through a montage of stunning images and a pulsating music soundtrack, “Thunder downunder” composed and performed by Markus Kellow.

results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: John Friedman and Education Development Center Film Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: Little big top
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the magic generated by the Royal Brothers’ Circus, a tent circus of a type that is fast disappearing. Torrential rains, axles sunk in mud, shaky performances, and a monumental tent that must be pulled up and down once a day do not inhibit the fifteen trucks and assorted beasts from travelling around at a rate of one town a day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Colin Low and Michael McKennirey

results.title: Little Big Man
results.creator_credit: Stuart Millar, Hiller Productions and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Arthur Penn’s adaptation of Thomas Berger’s novel shifts from comedy to drama as it depicts the horrific effects of American Imperialism. 121-year-old Jack Crabb narrates the story as the sole white survivor of the battle of Little Big Horn which saw the fall of General George A. Custer. He recounts his life story beginning with his adoption by Cheyenne Indians, where he was taught to live peacefully with nature. He later finds himself once again in the white world and is taken in by a preacher and his wife for religious education and guidance. He swaps his bible for a gun and be-friends Wild Bill Hickock, only to abandon even that to settle down and marry. Returning to the Cheyenne by chance, Crabb finds that he prefers this life, but is soon made aware of the carnage wreaked by white man. Cast includes: Dusitn Hoffman, Faye Dunaway, Martin Balsam, Richard Mulligan, and Chief Dan George.

results.title: Little Bear: hide and seek
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Nelvana, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Raymond Jafelice
results.brief_description: This video contains six delightful adventures of Little Bear, the furry fellow based upon the series of books written by Else Homelund Minarik and illustrated by Maurice Sendak. These animated works with their gentle rhythm and family values will delight the very young as Little Bear and his family and friends go about daily life in the forest. The programs are: “What will Little Bear wear?” Mother Bear teaches Little Bear that the best coat to keep him warm in winter is his own fur. “Hide and seek” a universal game played and enjoyed by Little Bear and his friends Cat, Hen, Duck and Owl. “Little Bear goes to the moon” Little Bear’s imagination takes off as he creates a special moon hat. “Birthday soup” to celebrate his birthday, Little Bear invites the gang over to share in some imaginary soup. “Polar Bear” Little Bear’s fur becomes a different colour after a painting mishap. “Gone Fishing” Little Bear goes fishing but takes his imagination with him.
